New Records: Nikola Jokic joins Russell Westbrook (Apr. 2, 2019) as the 2nd player to record a 20/20/15 game since Wilt Chamberlain in 1968.
Key Match Events: Peyton Watson made a game-sealing block with one second left to preserve the win for the Nuggets.
Nikola Jokic split a pair of free throws with 27 seconds left, but the Nuggets still managed to win.
Jalen Williams scored five straight to make it 123-120 entering the final minute.
Watson blocked Gilgeous-Alexander's last-second floater to preserve the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Nuggets played without Jamal Murray (concussion protocol) for the third straight game and without Aaron Gordon, who will miss multiple weeks due to a right calf strain.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic had 23 points, 20 rebounds and 16 assists, leading the Nuggets to a 124-122 win over the Thunder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder had opened with seven straight wins before losing to the Nuggets.
The Nuggets used a 40-point third quarter to storm back from a 66-55 halftime deficit.
Others: The technical foul on Denver coach Michael Malone sparked the Nuggets, who hit four shots from deep during a 24-6 run that gave Denver an 89-87 lead.
